含义: The character '戶' (hù) primarily means 'door' or 'household'. It is often used to refer to the entrance of a house or a family unit.
字形: The character '戶' is a pictograph that resembles a single-leaf door. It is composed of a simple structure with a horizontal line at the top representing the lintel and a vertical line representing the door itself.
读音: The pronunciation of '戶' is 'hù' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '戶' originated from ancient pictographs that depicted a single-leaf door. Over time, it evolved into its current simplified form.
常用词组: 戶主 (hù zhǔ) - head of household
成语: 家喻戶晓 (jiā yù hù xiǎo) - known by every household
戶枢不蠹 (hù shū bù dù) - a door hinge never gets worm-eaten
例句: 这家戶口登记得很详细。 (This household registration is very detailed.)
戶外活动对健康有益。 (Outdoor activities are beneficial to health.)
短故事: In ancient China, the character '戶' was used to denote the entrance of a house. It was believed that a well-maintained door would bring good fortune to the household. One story tells of a family who meticulously cared for their door, ensuring it was always clean and in good repair. As a result, they enjoyed prosperity and harmony for generations.

Another story involves a wise old man who advised his village to pay attention to their doors, as they were the first line of defense against evil spirits. The villagers followed his advice, and their community thrived, free from misfortune.
